why: Paced return prevents boom‑bust cycles and supports durable recovery.

slides.title: Gradual Return is Safer
slides.content: A phased return to work prevents re-injury and builds confidence through progressive exposure

slides.title: Modify Tasks Early
slides.content: Start with lighter duties and shorter hours; gradually build up as your body adapts.

slides.title: Communicate with Employer
slides.content: Open dialogue about your capabilities; agree on a supportive, phased return plan.

slides.title: Fear-Avoidance Cycle
slides.content: Avoiding work can increase fear and disability. Gradual return builds confidence and breaks the pain-fear cycle.

slides.title: Myth vs Fact
slides.content: Myth: Wait until pain is 0/10. Fact: Graded exposure is safe and effective.

slides.title: Try this next shift
slides.content: Plan two 3‑minute movement breaks per hour; track how you feel after.
